body_html:
Well, you can say that the contract for Variables is that new() will return a Variable, and Parameters don't change it 😉

As @zou3519 nicely pointed out, changing this would likely result in adding memory leaks to code that works fine today. Additionally, nn.Parameter is pretty much a way to require the user to explicitly annotate the Variables they want to be saved as parameters, and nothing more. I think it's a better idea to keep the behavior as is, but thanks for the suggestion!

body:
Well, you can say that the contract for `Variables` is that `new()` will return a `Variable`, and `Parameters` don't change it :wink:

As @zou3519 nicely pointed out, changing this would likely result in adding memory leaks to code that works fine today. Additionally, `nn.Parameter` is pretty much a way to require the user to explicitly annotate the Variables they want to be saved as parameters, and nothing more. I think it's a better idea to keep the behavior as is, but thanks for the suggestion!
